snippet: Should the Supreme Court agree to hear the case, it could issue its first major abortion ruling since 2007 before its next term ends in June.
abstract: Texas abortion providers ask Supreme Court to overrule appeals court decision that would limit state to 10 clinics; say 2013 legislation, which Texas lawmakers claim protect women's health, is costly, gratuitous and disingenuous bid to close clinics; case would give court chance to revise 1992 abortion ruling, which prohibited states' placing excessive restrictions on right to abortion.
lead_paragraph: Should the Supreme Court agree to hear the case, it could issue its first major abortion ruling since 2007 before its next term ends in June.

headline.main: Texas Abortion Providers Ask Supreme Court to Reverse Ruling on Clinics
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Urged to Reverse Ruling Seen as Onerous by Texas Abortion Providers
